Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: xargs
Description: Execute a command with whitespace-delimited strings (from stdin) as arguments

Arguments.Description: Use NUL (0x00) as a separator, instead of whitespace

Arguments.Name: E
Arguments.Description: Use this string as a logical EOF marker

Arguments.Name: eof-str
Arguments.Description: eof-str

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Replace occurrences of this string with the input

Arguments.Name: replacement-str
Arguments.Description: replacement-str

Arguments.Name: J
Arguments.Description: Replace an argument exactly equal to this string with the input

Arguments.Name: replacement-str
Arguments.Description: replacement-str

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: Run the program each time this many lines of input are read

Arguments.Name: number
Arguments.Description: number

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: The maximum number of arguments that can be taken from stdin on each run

Arguments.Name: number
Arguments.Description: number

Arguments.Name: o
Arguments.Description: Reopen stdin as /dev/tty (useful for running interactive applications)

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: Run up to this many commands in parallel (as many as possible if 0)

Arguments.Name: max-procs
Arguments.Description: max-procs

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: Prompt to run each command

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Run the command once if there's no input (compatible with GNU xargs)

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Specify the maximum number of occurrences that -I will replace

Arguments.Name: number
Arguments.Description: number

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: Specify the maximum size in bytes that -I can use for replacements (default: 255)

Arguments.Name: replacement-size
Arguments.Description: replacement-size

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of bytes that can be provided to the program (default: 4096)

Arguments.Name: max-args-size
Arguments.Description: max-args-size

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: Echo the command to stderr before it's executed

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Terminal if the arguments will not fit in the maximum line length

Arguments.Name: utility
Arguments.Description: utility
